discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
This is B

Selected Answer: B
PM should navigate executive to project information radiators to get the info which they want because all info record and store there

Selected Answer: B
In theory B, in practice C. If the CFO needs an update, you are not asking him to come down to your work space so he can look at a board. The CFO wants a slide that he can re-use in his own presentation.

Selected Answer: B
When an executive expresses interest in an update on an agile project, the project lead should ensure effective communication while minimizing disruptions to the team's work. Option B is the most appropriate course of action:

Selected Answer: B
B. Invite the executive to the project's meeting space to determine if the project information radiators meet their needs

Selected Answer: B
Option C suggests reaching out to the project management office (PMO) for status report templates and providing project updates in that format. While this could be a valid approach for status reporting in traditional project management, it may not align well with the agile approach.

In agile projects, the focus is on frequent and transparent communication, and information radiators such as task boards, burndown charts, and other visual indicators are commonly used to keep the team and stakeholders updated on progress. Agile projects generally emphasize face-to-face interactions and collaborative discussions over formal reports.

Selected Answer: B
Option B seems way more Agile than C.

Selected Answer: B
https://www.examtopics.com/discussions/pmi/view/50898-exam-pmp-topic-1-question-2553-discussion/

Selected Answer: C
I will go to C.

There is a clear explnation of what is information radiators in PMBOK as below
"Information radiator : This artifact is a visible, physical display that provides information to the rest of the organization, enabling timely knowledge sharing."

I don't think executive can be considered as "the rest of the organization".

I think executive is busy and has to decide many things. It means they need to shorten checking time for information. How to shorten this time? use something familiar with. that why we use report template if it exists.

Selected Answer: C
If the executive is not a part of the project team but a stakeholder then shouldn't PMO be contacted to ensure that the templates are good to communicate? Thoughts?

When an executive requests an update on an agile project, the project lead should invite them to the project's meeting space. This is because agile teams use visual information radiators to keep stakeholders informed of the project's progress. This will help the executive to see the current status of the project and understand how the team is working. Additionally, the project lead can use this opportunity to discuss any concerns or issues that the executive may have.

Selected Answer: B
B correct. Page 708 PMBook 6: These metrics and projections are shared with project stakeholders via trend graphs (information radiators) to communicate progress, share issues, drive continuous improvement activities, and manage stakeholder expectations.

Selected Answer: B
B is correct.
Sounds more like A to me. Any thoughts?

choices.B: Invite the executive to the project's meeting space to determine if the project information radiators meet their needs
choices.C: Reach out to the project management office (PMO) for status report templates and provide project updates in that format
choices.D: Ask the project sponsor or product owner to provide an update since the project lead should be trying to keep the team free from impediments
choices.A: Provide a link to the project's shared drive for the executive to search through for any artifacts that are of interest

questions.question_text:
The project sponsor on an agile project informed the project lead that an executive would like an update on the project's progress.
What should the project lead do?

choices.B: Industry trends and the technical approach
choices.C: Cost of delaying some features against business value
choices.A: Complexity and the cost of development
choices.E: Length of time each feature has been on the backlog

comments.content: I think it could be either or. A, C, and E are good answers to me. You want to talk about option A's complexity specifically because they mention that deliverables from the last iteration weren't completed, so thats definitely going to come up, along with the cost, either monetarily or via the schedule.
I am not sure if the length of the feature has anything to be done for the past deliverables and last iteration incompletion.

discussion.content:
C and E 

why complexity and cost Development ? nothing talk about that in the question

Selected Answer: AC
I am sticking with AC

Selected Answer: AC
Its important to VALUE

Selected Answer: AC
The key is value. C. Cost of development lower, business value will be relatively higher.
 E. Length of time being in backlog does not mean value.

Selected Answer: CE
considering that during the past iteration, some deliverables were not completed.This helps address the aging of backlog items and ensures that older items are reviewed and prioritized, taking into account their relevance and potential changes in business priorities.

Selected Answer: AC
A. Complexity and the cost of development
C. Cost of delaying some features against business value

Option C focuses on the impact of delaying certain features, taking into account the potential impact on the overall business value. This is a critical consideration, as it helps to ensure that the most important features are addressed first, thereby maximizing the value of the project.

questions.question_text:
A project manager is leading a meeting with key stakeholders, the project sponsor and the product owner to define the features that will be released after the next iteration. The purpose of the meeting is to review the product backlog prioritization, considering that during the past iteration some deliverables were not completed.
Which two items should be taken into account first to review and update the product backlog priorities during the meeting? (Choose two.)

A project manager led the implementation of an electronic invoicing project that has just been completed. The financial manager communicated that the team discovered three invoices with errors.
Which two documents should the project manager update as soon as possible? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
A&B. and for what its worth, I don't think a "backlog register" is a real thing. The change log is irrelevant because you haven't made any changes.

will go with AD. because you dont need to register a risk so quickly. so will go with issue log and change log

A. Issue log: The issue log is used to track and manage project issues, including any problems or errors encountered during the project. Updating the issue log with the information about the three invoices with errors will help ensure that the issues are properly recorded and can be addressed and resolved by the appropriate stakeholders.

D. Change log: The change log is used to track and document changes made during the project. In this case, the errors in the invoices may require corrective actions or changes to be made. By updating the change log, the project manager can capture the details of the errors and the actions taken to rectify them, providing a comprehensive record of the changes made to address the invoicing errors.

Selected Answer: AD
It is AD for Sure. This risk has occurred already which makes it an issue not risk also the next step in Change Log.

Selected Answer: AD
Issue and Change log

Selected Answer: AD
Risk is the assumption that a risk may occur. No danger has occurred. The danger has already arisen in the matter. That's why this is an issue.
This is why it is not B.
I think it should be AB. You update the risk Register by removing the realized risk into the issue log.

Selected Answer: AD
A. Issue log: This is the central repository for tracking all issues encountered during the project, including their status, resolution plan, and responsible parties. The discovered invoice errors clearly qualify as issues that need to be documented and tracked for resolution.

D. Change log: Since the errors represent deviations from the originally planned invoices, they constitute changes to the project deliverables. Recording these changes in the change log helps maintain an accurate history of the project and assess the potential impact on scope, timeline, or budget.

A. Issue Log: This document is crucial for tracking and managing issues encountered during the project. Updating the issue log with details about the identified errors in the invoices will ensure that these discrepancies are documented and can be addressed accordingly.

D. Change Log: In case the errors in the invoices require modifications, corrections, or any changes to the project deliverables or documents, updating the change log is essential. Any adjustments made to rectify the errors should be documented in the change log for proper tracking and future reference.

comments.content: D would have been true but the question says which docs need to be updated as soon as possible. Change log would be updated after the change request has been raised. Risk log would be updated and the remediation plan in it would be to create a change request and then it goes into change log. So, my answer is B instead of D

discussion.content: A y D. Registro de pedidos pendientes no hace sentido

Selected Answer: AD
Change log as after issue log, one need to fix it and that will require update in change log.
Risk register is not updated for issue already occurred.

Selected Answer: AB
According to Symea comment: " D & E don't make sense. I checked and this question was answered with A & B in the past (https://www.examtopics.com/discussions/pmi/view/62401-exam-pmp-topic-1-question-3415-discussion/) "
I shoose AE

Selected Answer: AB
those are definitely correct

Selected Answer: AD
A. Issue log
D. Change log

Selected Answer: DE
Change log because the work is completed already and any change will be considered as change request 
Backlog because is it considered as issue remaining from a completed project

Selected Answer: AD
A. Issue log: The issue log should be updated to document the discovery of the invoices with errors and track the actions taken to resolve the issues.

D. Change log: The change log should be updated to record any changes made to the project scope, schedule, or budget as a result of the discovery of the invoices with errors.

Selected Answer: AD
A. Issue log: The issue log should be updated to record the discovery of the three invoices with errors. This will ensure that the issues are documented and can be tracked for resolution.

D. Change log: If the errors in the invoices require corrective actions or changes to be made, the project manager should update the change log to reflect these modifications. This will help in managing the change requests and their impact on the project.

Selected Answer: AD
Why selecting the Risk register if it's already an issue? I think updating the change log makes more sense for providing a record of changes made and when. So A & D. Opinions?

Selected Answer: BD
BD - It is an issue not a risk. Once the issue log is updated, the PM needs to raise a CR to fix the problem, hence update the change log

Selected Answer: AB
D & E don't make sense. I checked and this question was answered with A & B in the past (https://www.examtopics.com/discussions/pmi/view/62401-exam-pmp-topic-1-question-3415-discussion/)
Why B? This is a issue, Do we need do anything with risk register?

I think it's AE. This is after the fact and not pre-issue. It is an issue and has to be logged. The issue also has to be entered into a backlog register as a prioritized deliverable that needs to be implemented. A risk register is generated before risks occurs, so it cannot be B. A change log is ideally a list of all changes made and tracked in the execution of a project.

Selected Answer: AD
It seems option A is unanimous. 

I opting for option A & C because the change log is used to document all change requests, including those that have not yet been approved or implemented.

Option B, the risk register, may not be as relevant in this scenario because the error in the invoices has already occurred, and the risk of such an error happening is no longer a future uncertainty that needs to be monitored and managed.
A-B the correct answers not D,E

Selected Answer: AB
Right answer A & B, this is invoice issue and NOT product or deliverables issue.
I think the answer is A and B. Can someone explain why is it D&E?

Selected Answer: D
Key words here are, "becomes more complex". That is when cross-functional teams with different approaches and skillset can get things done and smoothly.
Answer D

Selected Answer: B
Project team know exactly what is problem and who helpful to help them

Selected Answer: D
D. The cross-functional team members work together to complete the activity.

This approach leverages the diverse skills and expertise within a cross-functional team to tackle the complexity of the task. By collaborating closely, team members can identify and implement solutions more efficiently than working in isolation or waiting for external help. This method fosters innovation, accelerates problem-solving, and ensures that different perspectives are considered in addressing the complexity of the activity. It also aligns with agile principles, emphasizing teamwork, collaboration, and the ability to adapt to changing circumstances.

Selected Answer: D
Bringing in external support or specialists (options A and B) may introduce delays and go against the principles of a self-organizing team.

Selected Answer: D
Option B is better but can team members decide to bring in specialist. I think it needs to be decided by PM.
That is why D is next better choice as cross-functional team member is expected to have more skill to solve the problem.
If B is the answer then it should say PM instead of team members.

Selected Answer: D
https://www.examtopics.com/discussions/pmi/view/56747-exam-pmp-topic-1-question-1848-discussion/

Selected Answer: D
Is it the teams responsibility to hire a specialist?

Every one selected D but apparently B look more suitable in this scenario. because If we have already cross-functional team working together and an activity become more complex need to complete quickly. in this case need specialist(subject meter expert).
please correct me if I am wrong....

Selected Answer: D
D. The cross-functional team member work together to complete the activity

Selected Answer: D
First try to involve cross functional team members to take their views and if not solved then take help from specialist.

Selected Answer: D
O
Option D - having the cross-functional team members work together to complete the activity. This approach encourages collaboration, knowledge sharing, and leveraging the diverse skills and expertise of the team to tackle the complex activity effectively. By working together, the team members can brainstorm solutions, support each other, and collectively find the most efficient way to deliver the work in the shortest time possible.

Selected Answer: D
Should be D. It's an Agile common. "Swarming. A technique in which multiple team members focus collectively on resolving a specific impediment."
We can go with D, but the real world answer is B.
Answer is D

Selected Answer: D
What's happening to exam topics.

Selected Answer: D
The cross-functional team members should work together to complete the activity. This approach promotes collaboration and cross-functional teamwork, which can help identify and address any complexities that arise during the iteration. The team can leverage each other's strengths and knowledge to solve the problem and complete the activity in the shortest time possible. Bringing in an external specialist or moving the work to the backlog may cause delays and disrupt the team's momentum.
I will go with B

Selected Answer: B
D sound good. But I think key word: becomes more complex. and delivered in the shortest time possible...
-> so need special√≠st to help is fastest. 
Cross-functional team no ensure that having a person expert enough to resolve the complex...
A. Cross-functional team members are strong. They need to work together for the best solution and resolve the activity.
The correct is D
only specialist can help the team to deliver in the shortest time.

choices.A: The team facilitator gets support from external team members.
choices.D: The cross-functional team member work together to complete the activity
choices.B: The team members bring in a specialist to help them
choices.C: The product owner moves it to the product backlog.

questions.question_text:
During an iteration of a project, a planned activity becomes more complex. The work should be delivered in the shortest time possible.
What approach should be used in this situation?

choices.B: Evaluate the environmental and regulatory factors and identify high-level risks and assumptions
choices.C: Identify and monitor the risks closely since the company does not have lessons learned for this country
choices.D: Ensure that project sponsors are in agreement on the project deliverables and timeline during the project
choices.A: Acquire project resources from the new country to mitigate the risk of uncertainty

comments.content: why is it not D. Ensure that project sponsors are in agreement on the project deliverables and timeline during the project? Shouldn't the Business Case have considered the environmental factors, risks and assumptions already?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Evaluate the environmental and regulatory factors and identify high-level risks and assumptions

questions.question_text:
A multinational company has a plan to expand their business into a new country where they currently have no presence. A project manager is assigned to initiate this project.
After reviewing the business case, what should be considered first when developing an appropriate implementation strategy?
